it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib.plugs

Class TachoMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib.plugs.Plug<EV3.OutputPort>
      • it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib.plugs.TachoMotor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TachoMotor
extends Plug<EV3.OutputPort>
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This class offers methods for controlling the tacho motor of EV3 devices.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Set the speed percentage of the motor. This mode automatically enables speed control, which means the system will automatically adjust the power to keep the specified speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed percentage in the range [ -100 - 100 ].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setStepPower

        public void setStepPower(int power,
                         int step1,
                         int step2,
                         int step3,
                         boolean brake)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables specifying a full motor power cycle in tacho counts. Step1 specifyes the power ramp up periode in tacho count, Step2 specifyes the constant power period in tacho counts, Step 3 specifyes the power down period in tacho counts.
        Parameters:
        power - the power level within range [ -100 - 100 ].
        step1 - tacho pulses during ramp up.
        step2 - tacho pulses during continues run.
        step3 - tacho pulses during ramp down.
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setTimePower

        public void setTimePower(int power,
                         int step1,
                         int step2,
                         int step3,
                         boolean brake)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables specifying a full motor power cycle in time. Step1 specifyes the power ramp up periode in milliseconds, Step2 specifyes the constant power period in milliseconds, Step 3 specifyes the power down period in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        power - the power level within range [ -100 - 100 ].
        step1 - tacho pulses during ramp up.
        step2 - tacho pulses during continues run.
        step3 - tacho pulses during ramp down.
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setStepSpeed

        public void setStepSpeed(int speed,
                         int step1,
                         int step2,
                         int step3,
                         boolean brake)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables specifying a full motor power cycle in tacho counts. The system will automatically adjust the power level to the motor to keep the specified output speed. Step1 specifyes the power ramp up periode in tacho count, Step2 specifyes the constant power period in tacho counts, Step 3 specifyes the power down period in tacho counts.
        Parameters:
        speed - power level [-100 – 100].
        step1 - tacho pulses during ramp up.
        step2 - tacho pulses during continues run.
        step3 - tacho pulses during ramp down.
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setTimeSpeed

        public void setTimeSpeed(int speed,
                         int step1,
                         int step2,
                         int step3,
                         boolean brake)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables specifying a full motor power cycle in time. The system will automatically adjust the power level to the motor to keep the specified output speed. Step1 specifyes the power ramp up periode in milliseconds, Step2 specifyes the constant power period in milliseconds, Step 3 specifyes the power down period in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        speed - power level [-100 – 100].
        step1 - tacho pulses during ramp up.
        step2 - tacho pulses during continues run.
        step3 - tacho pulses during ramp down.
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setStepSync

        public void setStepSync(int power,
                        int turnRatio,
                        int step,
                        boolean brake)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables synchonizing two motors. Synchonization should be used when motors should run as synchrone as possible, for example to archieve a model driving straight. Duration is specified in tacho counts. The turn ratio behaves as follows: 0 : Motor will run with same power. 100 : One motor will run with specified power while the other will be close to zero. 200: One motor will run with specified power forward while the other will run in the opposite direction at the same power level.
        Parameters:
        power - power level [ -100 - 100 ].
        turnRatio - turn ratio [ -200 - 200 ].
        step - tacho pulses (0 = infinite).
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • setTimeSync

        public void setTimeSync(int power,
                        int turnRatio,
                        int time,
                        boolean brake)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method enables synchonizing two motors. Synchonization should be used when motors should run as synchrone as possible, for example to archieve a model driving straight. Duration is specified in time. The turn ratio behaves as follows: 0 : Motor will run with same power. 100 : One motor will run with specified power while the other will be close to zero. 200: One motor will run with specified power forward while the other will run in the opposite direction at the same power level.
        Parameters:
        power - power level [ -100 - 100 ].
        turnRatio - turn ratio [ -200 - 200 ].
        time - time in milliseconds (0 = infinite).
        brake - break level [false: Float, true: Break].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.
